wordpressPost.title: Corporate Signals a Sustainability Shift
wordpressPost.content:
This New Year, C-suites around the world are buzzing with serious interest on measures to limit their companies’ carbon emissions.

The momentum is impressive: Sustainability is shifting from nice-to-have’ to must-have.’
Across the globe and including all sectors of business, giant companies are making unprecedented and bold moves. Environmentally Friendly, with its slightly furry tree hugger overtones, is yielding to Corporate Imperative.
Corporations that your grandparents knew well are partnering with disruptive start-ups to make the change happen. Take General Motors‘ investment of $500 million in Lyft, the 3-year-old ridesharing company, announced this week.
In another branch of GM’s vast operation, engineers are finalizing details on a new electric vehicle that breaks the 200-mile range.
Customers are lining up. Entire corporate fleets are poised to transform themselves via the Chevy Bolt, and why not? This is truly the first EV that cracks the code because of long range at an affordable price, CEO Mary Barra says.
One such prospective buyer says the new 200-mile range triggers his interest. Bingo! That’s the business plan: All of our research shows the buyer consideration goes up dramatically with a range of over 150 miles, according to Pam Fletcher, G.M.’s chief engineer for electric vehicles.
Our team at WeSpire is inspired by the commitment of these large organizations on positive impacts.
Have you heard about the new Chevy Bolt? What’s your organization doing to create a sustainable impact? Tell us in the comments!
